# Module :: deskinparser.libutilities:¶

  • Created on Wed Jul 26 10:29:43 2017
  • Deskin - Orange Labs - Lannion - France

The common methods and constants useful for deskin parser functionality and not restricted to a singel module or a single class. One can call these variables global dependencies for the parser functionality

libutilities.BASIC_TEN_SLOT_TYPE = 10

The basic format of a line (a token definition) in CoNLL format

libutilities.COMPOUND_DEFINITION = 11

A newer addition that represents the contraction (e.g. du = de + le) that has been split into two tokens. The representation is the token IDs that are originaly together.

libutilities.DETAIL_RELATION = 9

Defining the connection of an unit element to a relation through both the existance of the element in a particuler relation and whether it is the head or the dependance.

libutilities.EXTERNAL_EMBEDDING = 7

Some sort of external embedding

libutilities.GPOS = 2

Pertaining to general PoS of a unit element

libutilities.HASH_BLOCKSIZE = 65536

Default buffer size for file hash generation

libutilities.LEMMA = 1

Pertaining to lemma of a unit element

libutilities.META_EXTENSION = '.cmeta'

Extension for the metadata file

libutilities.MORPH = 4

Pertaining to morphological definition of a unit element

libutilities.ONE_HOT_VECTOR = 6

One hot encoded vector

libutilities.ONE_HOT_VECTOR_DIMENSION_MULTIPLYER = 1.5

In case of one hot encoded vector definition the vector size multiplier allows the accomodation of new entitis to be incorporated in the vector.

libutilities.POS = 3

Pertaining to deailes or more granuler PoS of a unit element

libutilities.RELATION = 5

Pertaining to dependency relation of a unit element

libutilities.RELATION_DISTRIBUTION = 19

Metadata data structure keys for json export and import (range 12-19)

libutilities.SIMPLE_RELATION = 8

Defining the connection of an unit element to a relation through the existance of the element in a particuler relation

libutilities.TOKEN = 0

Pertaining to token or surface form of a unit element

libutilities.doesTheFileExist(file_path=None)

Method to check if file path (file_path) is correct and the file actually exists.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The full path of the file to be tested.
Returns:

True or False.
Return type:

bool
Raises:
  • noneFilePathError – If the the file path is None.
  • nonStringFilePathError – If the the file path is not a String.
  • zeroLengthStringPathError – If the the file path is a zero length String.
  • pathDoesNotExistError – If file path doesnot exist.
  • pathIsDirectoryException – If the path is a directory.
 
>>> doesTheFileExist(file_path='/my/own/path/fakedata.conll')
True
libutilities.generate_hash(source_file=None)

Method to generate the hash value (SHA1) for the given input file (source_file). Primary use is the comparison of a file in two different time to test consistency.

Parameters:source_file (str) – The full path of the file to be hashed.
Returns:The hash code for the input file.
Return type:str
Raises:invalidFilePathException – Source file path is not valid. 
>>> generate_hash(source_file='/my/own/path/fakedata.conll')
'328eabe02b7e4540531681be603d51c5a0d97c53'

Note

The source file cannot be None, has to be a String containing complete path and must exist.

libutilities.is_integer(test_val=None)

Method to test if the test value (test_val) is a valid integer or not. If the test value is an integer True will be returned other wise a False will be returned.

Parameters:test_val (str or int or float) – The value to be tested
Returns:True or False
Return type:bool 
>>> is_integer(test_val="23")
True
>>> is_integer(test_val=2.0)
True
>>> is_integer(test_val="2.33")
False

# Module :: deskinparser.libconll:¶

# Module :: deskinparser.libvector:¶

Created on Tue Jul 18 11:21:34 2017

Deskin - Orange Labs - Lannion - France

descript: to be done soon

class libvector.unitVectorConfiguration(reader=None, external=None, relation=None, debug=False)

The class to be used to define the input vectors for the parsing task. A default configuration will be initialized along with the API providing options to configure as per necessary.

BASE_CONFIGURATION = {0: 6, 1: 6, 2: 6, 3: 6, 4: 6, 5: 8}

The base configuration is the basis of how the unit vectors shall be defined. The update to this configuration will occure, during the execution of the constructor or afterward through the updates of other models e.g. update of “EXTERNAL_EMBEDDING” will also update this configuration model.

EXTERNAL_EMBEDDING = {0: None, 1: None, 2: None, 3: None, 4: None, 5: None}

The external embedding model allowes the use of externer embeddings for different elements of a unit vector. The changes for this model can be made during the execution of the constructor or afterward through update method ().

update_configuration(rel_type=None)
validate_external_embedding(embedding_map=None)

# Module :: deskinparser.libexceptions:¶

  • Created on Wed Aug 23 13:51:46 2017
  • Deskin - Orange Labs - Lannion - France

The user-defined exceptions are put together in this libreary. The names are quite expainatory.
